intro: Tabernaemontana salzmannii var. rauvolfiae, commonly known as the Rauvolfia tabernaemontana, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its evergreen leaves and clusters of fragrant, tubular flowers that bloom in shades of white and pink. The plant belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and requires partial to full sunlight for optimal growth. This species is also valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine for its potential medicinal properties.
